summary:
I am working in art & photography as an editor, educator & multimedia artist. 

50 % of my time I spend at Willem de Kooning Academy where I function as the co-courseleader of the photography department and teacher of photography. I also develop personal art projects such as the recent multimedia project Letters From The Past, tackling the theme of sexual abuse within the family. Next to that I run projects like Transformations: exploring the changes in photography, I coach artists / photographers and engage with beautiful social organisations like Fier. 

Previously I functioned as the creative director at Fotomat and senior producer & Interim manager at World Press Photo’s education department.

lettersfromthepast.nl
rebeccasimons.com

treasury_media.title: Latest personal project...
treasury_media.description:
'Letters from the Past' is a multimedia project consisting of a film, exhibition and educational program talks about sexual abuse within the family. It aims to open doors for a wider and more nuanced discussion by not only pointing at the abuser, but also looking at how we relate to the complexity of the situation. The broader context addresses questions about how our identity is formed through family history and how trauma can be passed down through generations.
www.lettersfromthepast.nl

treasury_media.title: Latest publication....
treasury_media.description:
The publication 'Transformations, Exploring Changes in and Around Photography' reflects on what they see as the most interesting transformations in and around photography today. Through essays, interviews, photographic work and short quotes, it raises a conversation on how technological changes and shifts within the industry affect the role and work of the photographer today. 
https://viewbook.com/transformations

treasury_media.title: My latest educational project...
treasury_media.description:
El-Art (Entrepreneurial Learning for Artists) is set up to help integrate entrepreneurship in European art schools through the development and distribution of teaching material and training programs for teachers and students. The material Creativity as a Career produced by El-Art is also suitable for starting creatives who are looking to strengthen their entrepreneurial skills. 
www.creativityasacareer.com

treasury_media.title: Recent exhibitions I curated...
treasury_media.description:
De Asielzoekmachine is a cross-media project that investigates the complex world of Dutch asylum policy and offers citizens an opportunity to think along. The exhibitions are showing 31 photographers and artists and consist of a DIY exhibition, and exhibition in Humanity House, The Hague and Melkweg, Amsterdam.
http://www.asielzoekmachine.nl/

treasury_media.title: More about me...
treasury_media.description: Visit my website for more impressions of recent projects.

school.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

projects.title: Transformations
projects.description:
Role: Co-founder / Coordinator

Transformations believes in photography as a powerful medium because it is adaptable and accessible and able to reach a wide audience. At the same time we believe there is a need to come together to reflect, connect and find cross-border and cross-disciplinary exchange for further growth and innovation. 

By bringing people together we want to stimulate critical reflection, discussion and spark new collaborations. We organize physical get togethers for different target groups to ignite conversation, inspiration, learning, creating, frustrating and new connections. 

More practical this means:
- workshops
- training of trainers
- round table discussions
- brainstorms 
- labs
- lectures and seminars
- moderation
- informal meetings and get togethers

We do this individually, and as a team and often with our team of other professionals, the Transformers.

projects.title: Asielzoekmachine
projects.description:
Role: Curator and producer of exhibitions
De Asielzoekmachine is a cross-media project initiated by Eefje Blankevoort (Prospektor) and Els van Driel that investigates the complex world of Dutch asylum policy and offers citizens an opportunity to think along. It consists of a series of events and meetings, exhibitions, an online documentary, a TV documentary and a series of documentaries.

projects.title: Editing for Narrative Impact Workshop
projects.description:
Role: Coordinator and trainer 
The workshop was set up to strengthen the editing skills of photographers, specifically selecting and sequencing images in a story. The two-days course covered editing photo stories for different types of publication, and also submissions for grants and awards.

projects.title: Editing a Portfolio Workshop
projects.description:
Role: Coordinator and trainer 
This workshop was set up during the Chobi Mela festival, together with Reem Saouma. The workshop focused on the dos and don’ts of photography portfolio editing.

projects.title: El-Art
projects.description:
Role: Initiator / Project Manager
El-Art (Entrepreneurial Learning for Artists) is set up to help integrate entrepreneurship in European art schools through the development and distribution of teaching material and training programs for teachers and students. The aim of the programme is to help art schools give their students the entrepreneurial skills necessary to thrive before they enter the working arena. The material Creativity as a Career produced by El-Art is also suitable for starting creatives who are looking to strengthen their entrepreneurial skills.

projects.title: Viewbook Transformations
projects.description:
Role: co-initiator and coordinator 
Viewbook Transformations is a program designed to explore these new challenges to photography and is aimed at promoting high­quality work, especially the use of photographs as part of a sustained in­-depth narrative. The program includes an annual $5,000 grant, and publishes visual stories. To spark dialogue we have assembled an expert team. Guest writers will share their ideas and vision on changes in photography.

contributors.headline: Working in and beyond photography.

projects.title: Joop Swart Masterclass
projects.description:
Role: Project Coordinator
The Joop Swart Masterclass has been organized by World Press Photo every year since 1994.
Its goal is to bring together some of the most experienced individuals in photojournalism with young, promising photographers to share and pass on their knowledge and experience.

projects.title: Connected Learning
projects.description:
Role: Editor in Chief 
#ConnectedLearning is a free educational platform of World Press Photo Academy which allows you to engage with learning material and join the WPPh network.
The Connected Learning Facebook page functions as a platform for sharing ideas and material on the various aspects of visual storytelling. The page allows you to engage freely with material from various educational programs offered by World Press Photo Academy.

projects.title: Reporting Change
projects.description:
Role: Producer / Project Manager
The project Reporting Change runs between 2012 and 2014, in the aftermath of the Arab Spring. World Press Photo and Human Rights Watch aim to report on and support democratic transitions in the Middle East and North Africa, using complementary approaches — visual journalism training in the case of World Press Photo, and research and advocacy in the case of Human Rights Watch.‎

profile_positions.title: co-course leader of the Photography department

profile_positions.description: I have a part time employment at Willem de Kooning Photography department as photography teacher. I also coordinate the 1st years and am part of the positioning team of the department.
profile_positions.title: Teacher of Photography & team leader

profile_positions.description: I set up photography and art programs, give workshops and guide photographers. I curate exhibitions and edit for various productions.
profile_positions.title: Photography coordinator, editor and educator

profile_positions.description: Transformations arranges educational activities and sparks critical reflection around photography. We organize physical get togethers and collaborations to ignite conversation, inspiration and new connections.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder & Coordinator

profile_positions.description: I give creative workshops for women and children at Fier and brainstorm sessions to help support the needs of children in the shelters.
profile_positions.title: Creative workshops and brainstorm activities

profile_positions.description: Fotomat builds publishing tools and empowers visual creators to help them create impact through their work. Current products consist of a modular website builder for visual makers. Fotomat also features interesting stories through Fotomat Watch and arranges Sessions to support the makers in the production of their presentations.
profile_positions.title: Creative Director

profile_positions.description: Working freelance (currently 2 days / week) as photo editor at the Dutch daily Volkstrant  - section V (art, media, food, film, life, fashion, photography, theater and TV).
profile_positions.title: Freelance Photo Editor

profile_positions.description: For 6 years I worked as a Producer and Project manager for World Press Photo Academy. My job was mainly focused on producing books, exhibitions and online productions.  I was also coordinating the annual Joop Swart Masterclass and other workshops around the world (see projects below).
profile_positions.title: Senior Producer & Project Manager

profile_positions.description: As interim manager at the WPPh I was responsible for the strategy, planning and operations of the education department.
profile_positions.title: Interim Manager Education

profile_positions.description: I worked a year as a coordinator for the fine art and media department and stayed 5 years as educator of Photography and New media. After that I continued setting up international projects for the school and to do photography training on workshop basis.
profile_positions.title: Educator and International Project manager
